chef_bio: Somchai Supasorn is a talented chef with five years of experience in the culinary world. He has created 50 unique and delicious recipes that have gained him a following of over 100 fans. Somchai is passionate about using fresh, locally sourced ingredients to create meals that are both healthy and tasty.

recipe_info.name: Tom Yum Goong
recipe_info.cooking_method: In a pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil.Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chilies to the pot.Let simmer for 10-15 minutes.Add the tomato, mushrooms, and shrimp to the pot.Cook until the shrimp turns pink, about 2-3 minutes.Add the fish sauce, lime juice, and cilantro to the pot.Serve hot.

recipe_info.name: Pad Thai
recipe_info.cooking_method: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes until softened. Drain and set aside.In a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and shallots and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.Add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.Push the shrimp to one side of the pan and add the beaten eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix with the shrimp.Add the rice noodles, peanuts, and bean sprouts to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the noodles are heated through and the bean sprouts are slightly wilted.In a small bowl, mix together the fish sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, and chili flakes. Pour the sauce over the noodle mixture and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes until everything is well-coated.Garnish with sliced green onions, cilantro leaves, and lime wedges. Serve hot.

recipe_info.name: Massaman Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken or beef, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipe_info.cooking_method: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken or beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the meat from the pot and set aside.In the same pot, add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.Add the coconut milk, chicken or beef broth, Massaman curry paste, brown sugar, potatoes, peanuts, fish sauce, tamarind paste, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, bay leaves, and star anise. Stir well to combine.Add the browned meat back to the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the meat is tender and the potatoes are cooked through.Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, if necessary.Serve the Massaman curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

recipe_info.name: Green Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken or tofu, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipe_info.cooking_method: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken or tofu and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the meat or tofu from the pot and set aside.In the same pot, add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.Add the coconut milk, chicken or vegetable broth, green curry paste, brown sugar, bell pepper, green beans, zucchini, fish sauce, and lime juice. Stir well to combine.Add the browned meat or tofu back to the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, if necessary.Serve the Green Curry hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves.
